document_title: Early stage (early) breast cancer: Symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-vu-giai-doan-dau.json_6_Side effects of breast cancer treatments
subsection_content:
Any treatment carries the risk of complications or unwanted side effects.
Surgical complications include: Infection, pain, bleeding, cosmetic problems, permanent scarring, changes or loss of sensation in the breast area and reconstructed breasts.; Side effects of chemotherapy include: Nausea/vomiting and diarrhea, hair loss, memory loss, vaginal dryness, menopausal symptoms, fertility problems, neuropathy.; Side effects associated with hormonal therapy include: Hot flashes, dry vaginal discharge, fatigue, nausea.; Radiation therapy can cause the following side effects: Pain and skin changes, fatigue, nausea, hair loss, heart and lung problems (long-term), neuropathy.
Patients may experience side effects during and after treatment such as hair loss, vomiting, fatigue...
Breast cancer is the most common cancer diagnosed in women, accounting for more than one in 10 new cancer cases diagnosed each year. It is the second most common cause of cancer death in women in the world. Breast cancer in women occurs at all ages after puberty but the incidence increases as age increases. According to Globocan statistics in 2020, Vietnam had 21,555 new cases of breast cancer, accounting for 25.8% of all types of cancer in women, including more than 9,345 deaths from this disease.
To schedule an appointment for breast cancer examination, screening and treatment at Tam Anh General Hospital, please contact:
Dr. Khiem advised that treatment for early stage breast cancer usually brings good results with a survival rate of almost 100%. Therefore, early detection of breast cancer is the premise for the best treatment. Women should regularly examine their breasts to detect changes in the skin and breast tissue. You should have a regular health check every 6 months and go to the hospital immediately when you notice any suspicious signs.
